thread.title: 10 things to do this long weekend
thread.title_full: 10 things to do this long weekend

title: 10 things to do this long weekend
text:
10 things to do this long weekend 2nd Oct 2015 6:48 AM AUSSIE LEGENDS: Hoodoo Gurus will perform at the Caloundra Music Festival. Ken Butti Cars For Sale 
1. NAMBA NOW! LIVE AFTER FIVE 
ON the first Friday of every month, C-Square presents an exciting line-up of live original music. This month, Karen Law Band, Liam James Campbell and Bub-Kiss take to the stage. Showcase returns with a boutique suitcase market presented by The Bison Bar. Pop-up beer and wine bar. Food carts include ii-Naa Japanese, Pops Hangi, The Bali Cart and Sweet Floz Churros. The Loose Kaboose train tram is back. Late night shopping at Seek & Find (for lovers of vintage). 
Where: C-Square Courtyard, Nambour Civic Centre. 
When: Tonight, 5.30pm-8.30pm. 
Info: facebook.com/CSquareNambour. 
2. CALOUNDRA MUSIC FESTIVAL 
IF you're planning on heading to this year's Caloundra Music Festival and haven't bought tickets yet, hop to it, as tomorrow is already a sell-out, but tickets to all other days were still available. There is some outstanding value on the public holiday on Monday with tickets starting from just $5 for kids and $45 for adults and a terrific line-up that includes Kate Ceberano, Joe Camilleri and Pseudo Echo. 
Where: Kings Beach, Caloundra. 
Bookings/info: http://www.caloundramusicfestival.com.au 
3. BATS THEATRE 
BATS Theatre Company at Buderim presents Agatha Christie's classic, And Then There Were None, designed to thrill and treat the audience with an evening or afternoon of mystery and comedy. 
Where: Buderim War Memorial Hall, cnr Main and Church Sts. 
When: Evening: Oct 2, 3, 9 and 10 at 7.30pm. Matinees: Oct 4 and 10 at 2pm. 
Cost: Adults $20, concession $18, members/uni students $16, school students $14. BYO drinks and nibbles. 
Bookings: http://www.batstheatre.com or phone 54452515. 
4. SPRING ART SPECTACULAR 
BLACKALL Range Visual Artists are holding a Spring Art Spectacular until Monday at St Mary's Hall in Montville. The group of talented local artists paint in pastel, watercolour, oil and acrylics so there is a wide range of different paintings to view or buy. All commissions are donated to the upkeep of St Mary's Hall. 
Where: St Mary's Hall in Montville. 
When: Open 10am to 4pm daily, until Monday. 
Cost: Free. 
5. LIVE SATURDAY ARVO SESSION 
THE Pub at Aussie World is excited to be bringing back the blues, roots and rock to the Sunshine Coast during this exciting time for original live music. Go along this week to enjoy Dan Hannaford's music. 
Where: Aussie World Pub. 
Cost : Free entry. 
6. FLOATING LAND 
THERE will be many fun and creative things to see and do at Floating Land at Boreen Point including an artist studio trail, Jazz Trio Dawn Concert, foreshore artworks, twilight markets, Heart of Gold films and Apollonian jam sessions. 
Where: Boreen Point. 
When: Until Monday - sunrise, sunset and in-between. 
Cost: Free. 
Info: 53296253. 
7. HIGH TEA FUNDRAISER 
MASCARA-THON, Lip Gloss fundraiser for Cancer Council Qld. Lots of fun - giveaways and raffles aplenty. For every person who brings four friends they will receive a free product. Guest compere Ashlea Gierke from Hot 91.1. 
Where: The Edge, 127 Parkyn Pde, Mooloolaba Wharf. 
When: Tomorrow 9.30am for 10am start. 
Cost: $25 - pre-purchase tickets so as not to miss out. 
Contact: Mary-Ann Rose 54450713 or 0414981021. 
8. OPEN WATER SWIMMING MEET 
THE Vorgee Brisbane Open Water Swimming Meet is open to SQ registered swimmers, members of clubs affiliated with other state swimming associations, international swimmers who meet clearance criteria, and Queensland Masters registered swimmers. Race times start around 9am and go until about 3pm. Where: Lake Kawana. 
When: Tomorrow 9am-3pm.
